title: Ibis Mummy
description: Mummified Ibis. Head given a cartonnage mask, now broken.

museum_location.name: This item is not on view

labels.title: 37.1986E
labels.content:
The shape of this animal mummy resembles that of a human mummy or the figure of the god Osiris, king of the dead. The painted plaster remains of an elaborate headdress, like those worn by kings, and a curved beard also emphasized for an Egyptian viewer this mummy’s close connection with Osiris.

The X-ray shows a complete ibis inside the wrappings.

collections.name: Egyptian, Classical, Ancient Near Eastern Art

exhibitions.title: Soulful Creatures: Animal Mummies in Ancient Egypt
